runs.comm: inswinging and full, dug out into the leg side
full but a bit wider and no swing, pushed to short extra cover
short and wide, Gilchrist slashes and misses to loud gasps from the crowd
lovely drive, threaded between mid-off and extra cover, not a big gap but he found it and the ball scoots away
back and turned off his hips to deepish square leg
pulled into the ground and so it loses much of the power, still a single
full (81mph) and it completely deceives Hayden who shapes to thump it out of the ground
full and this time Hayden hammers the ball between Flintoff and mid-on, no real effort but he's such a big man that it races away
mid-on drops a little deeper so Hayden pushes to him and ambles the single
fuller and outside off, Gilchrist leans back, swipes, and misses
defensive push towards mid-on, Gilchrist then spots the fielder is deeper and slightly slow off the mark and so is able to sprint the single
driven hard back to the bowler, the ball bounces kindly allowing Flintoff to collect in his follow through
short and wide, Gilchrist slashes and a thick top edge flies over the grasp of the leaping Prior
he goes to pull, misses, the ball thuds into his body and drops almost at his feet , Hayden calls him through
another full-bodied slash flies wide and high past Prior
fuller, Hayden forced back and he drives to mid-off who is closer to prevent the single
short and pulled behind square, Maddy hurtles round and slides to cut off the ball in the deep
firm drive to mid-off
full and Hayden decides very late to leave the ball and does so with a twirl of the body in the crease
dug in and Hayden looks to pull but misses and gets hit on the shoulder for his pains
pulled from off stump over midwicket, the ball lands five yards in from the rope and plugs. Tiger Woods would have been proud of that backspin
another mistimed pull, it hits him on the body and trundles fine on the leg side, Broad has a long way to get round the retrieve
an uppish slash which falls four or five yards short of Schofield at third man
Hayden leans back and tries to hammer the ball through the covers, gets a thick leading edge and it bobbles back to the bowler
flicked into the leg side at a very pedestrian pace ... which is what Collingwood is bowling
a sniff of swing, Gilchrist pushes into the on side off his pads
swpet with a hint of bottom edge, the ball goes down to long leg
slashed over backward point, in the air but well over the fielder even though he threw himself at it
slower ball swung over deep midwicket and brilliantly caught ... by a spectator in the front row who celebrates like a wild thing
low full toss driven to long-on
half volley smacked dismissively back from whence it came, not quite timed as it bounced before it got to the rope
slower ball, this time stroked between mid-off and extra cover ... that was all about timing. The first shot was Shrek, that one was Cinderella
and again, heaved through midwicket, no grace, maximum effect
a dot ball eases the nerves of the English supporters ... Andrew Miller was beginning to fret about Australia managing 20 an over to eliminate England!
fuller, worked to deep midwicket
leg-side half volley, picked up and flicked over short fine leg
Hayden down on one knee before the bowler had let go of the ball, sweeping behind square
cut to deep point
heaved by Hayden back over the bowler, not middled so it falls 10 yards short of the rope, Broad round from long-on to field
Gilchrist makes width and cuts
too short, too wide and pulled off the front foot behind square on the leg side
driven hard but not timed and it bounces back to a relieved Mascarenhas
backfoot drive into the deep cover region
full-bloodied off drive to Broad at long-off
almost a yorker, a bit too full, Gilchrist gets a thick inside edge and the ball zips past his leg stump and fine for four
right up once more, wide of off stump, Gilchrist can only squeeze it to backward point
much the same spot from Flintoff but Gilchrist works it finer and that takes it past the fielder
Flintoff perseveres with that line and it works as Hayden can only jam down on it to backward point
Gilchrist back and defends
Gilchrist gives him the change but doesn't really connect and Flintoff speeding in from long-on dives to take a good catch a foot above the turf
jammed into the ground and it loops back to the bowler. Loud cheers from those in the crowd who thought it was a catch
swished to deep midwicket, all along the ground
leg side, pulled round along the ground behind square
tried to turn into the on side but not timed
driven, he aimed into the on side but it ended up heading to mid-off
in the slot and a bullying thump over wide long-on, flat and it flew like a tracer bullet
a reverse sweep which he doesn't really get hold of but it goes fine off his gloves and they all count
full, rasping drive to long-off, Hayden walks the single
quick single off a defensive push into the off side
another easy single into the leg side, the batsmen barely had to break into a sweat ...which sums up Australia's easy progress
tries the sweep
cut away forcefully in front of point
flipper, straight on to Ponting, who tries the cut to gully
pitches just outside leg, the batsman gets over it and paddle- sweeps softly behind square
drives off the legs to short midwicket
driven out to cover
finds some left and Ponting jumps up to play back down
pushed through midwicket for an easy single
driven out straight to long-on for another easy single
down the track and pulled hard in front of midwicket, bringing up the hundred in dominant style
down the track for an easy drive to mid-on
straight and with enough room to pull through midwicket
wide outside off, driven out to deep extra cover
whirrs it in straight, driven to cover
comes down the track, so Schofield follows him down leg - stray s too far and Ponting sweeps straight, hard and long
defended on the front foot
down leg, lapped round the corner through fine leg
extra loop, outside off now, driven back out wide of long-on
full toss slips out down off, driven out through extra
short and helped down to long leg, Schofield tidying up
driven back up to Flintoff who stretches out a giant left hand to snap it up easy as you like
full delivery, driven out to mid-on
driven to cover
pushed up there outside off and driven back out straight
typical Hayden: one step, boom; a powerful (aren't they all?) drive through mid-off
driven again through mid-off - nearly taking out Symonds at the other end - and the end is nigh
driven wider of mid-off this time
loopy full toss down leg, paddled almost sympathetically round to fine leg
...yes, a drive through mid-on to complete a handsome win
